title: Linux finger Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux finger command, which provides user information, and learn how to customize its output for practical use in user and permission management.

meta.title: Linux finger Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux finger command, which provides user information, and learn how to customize its output for practical use in user and permission management.
meta.keywords: Linux, finger command, user information, permission management, user management, command line, system administration

verify.name: Verify finger command is installed
verify.hint:
The finger command is not installed. Please run the following command to install it:
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install -y finger

steps.title: Displaying User Information with the finger Command

verify.name: Verify finger command displays user information
verify.hint: The finger command did not display information for the labex user. Please ensure the labex user is logged in and try running the finger command again.

verify.name: Verify finger command with -l option
verify.hint: The finger command with -l option did not display the correct user information for the labex user. Please ensure the labex user is configured correctly and try running the command again.

verify.name: Verify finger command with -p option
verify.hint: The finger command with -p option did not display the correct user information for the labex user. Please ensure the labex user is configured correctly and try running the command again.
